qas.question: "An Account of Further Discoveries in Air" was published by who in 1775?
What was the occupation of Joseph Priestley?
By sunlight, what compound did  Priestley concentrate on to make the gas he called "dephlogisticated air"?
The symbol for mercuric oxide is?
What chemical did Priestley use in his experiments on oxygen?
What did Priestley name the gas his experiment produced?

Why is Priestley usually given credit for being first to discover oxygen?

answers.text: Because he published his findings first

qas.question: What effect did breathing Priestley's discovered gas have on the experiment's mouse?

answers.text: was more active and lived longer
more active and lived longer while breathing it
was more active and lived longer

qas.question: Who conducted an experiment on August 4, 1774?
What did Joseph Priestley's August 4, 1774 experiment focus on?

plausible_answers.text: "An Account of Further Discoveries in Air"

qas.question: What did Priestley name the air he created?

context: In the meantime, on August 1, 1774, an experiment conducted by the British <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><a1_3><a1_4>clergyman<a1_4/><a1_3/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/> <a0_0><a0_2><a0_3><b9_0>Joseph Priestley<b9_0/><a0_3/><a0_2/><a0_0/> focused <b10_0>sunlight on <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><a2_3><a2_4><a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><a4_3><a4_4>mercuric oxide<a4_4/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/><a2_4/><a2_2/><a2_1/> (<a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><a3_3><a3_4>HgO<a3_4/><a3_3/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/>)<b10_0/><a4_3/><a2_3/><a2_0/> inside a glass tube, which liberated a gas he named <a5_4>"<a5_0><a5_1><a5_2><a5_3><b12_0>dephlogisticated air<b12_0/><a5_4/><a5_3/><a5_2/><a5_1/><a5_0/>". He noted that candles burned brighter in the gas and that a mouse <a8_2><a8_4>was <a8_1><a8_3>more <a8_0>active<a8_0/> and lived longer<a8_4/><a8_2/><a8_1/> while breathing it<a8_3/>. After breathing the gas himself, he wrote: "The feeling of it to my lungs was not sensibly different from that of common air, but I fancied that my breast felt peculiarly light and easy for some time afterwards." <a0_1><a0_4>Priestley<a0_4/><a0_1/> published his findings in <a6_0><a6_1><a6_2><a6_3><a6_4>1775<a6_4/><a6_3/><a6_2/><a6_1/><a6_0/> in a paper titled <b11_0>"An Account of Further Discoveries in Air"<b11_0/> which was included in the second volume of his book titled Experiments and Observations on Different Kinds of Air. <a7_4>Because <a7_1><a7_2><a7_3>he <a7_0>published his findings first<a7_4/><a7_3/><a7_2/><a7_1/><a7_0/>, Priestley is usually given priority in the discovery.
